TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit GacMembershipCondition extends System.Object implements class System.Security.ISecurityEncodable, class System.Security.ISecurityPolicyEncodable, class System.Security.Policy.IMembershipCondition

Docs.summary: Determines whether an assembly belongs to a code group by testing its global assembly cache membership. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks All assemblies installed in the global assembly cache are granted the `FullTrust` permission set.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the use of the GacMembershipCondition class.
[!code-cpp[System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.policy_2_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.policy_2_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.policy_2_1.cs)]

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Code satisfies this membership condition if it is installed in the global assembly cache.

Docs.param: The against which to make the test.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition.
Docs.returns: if the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This membership condition tests <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacInstalled> evidence.

Docs.summary: Creates an equivalent copy of the membership condition.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A copy of a membership condition is identical to the original membership condition.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the Copy method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> class.
[!code-cpp[System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.policy_26_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.policy_26_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.policy_26_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool Equals (object o);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object o) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to compare with the current object.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the current object is equivalent to the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks There are no degrees of global assembly cache membership. An assembly is either in the cache or it is not. If the object identified by `o` is a <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition>, then the objects being compared are equal. This method returns `false` only if `o` is `null` or if `o` is not a <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition>.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the Equals method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> class.
[!code-cpp[System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#5](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.policy_33_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.policy_33_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.policy_33_1.cs)]

Docs.param: The that contains the XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
Docs.summary: Uses the specified XML encoding to reconstruct a security object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The FromXml method reconstructs a <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> from an XML encoding defined by the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class. Use the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition.ToXml%2A> method to XML-encode the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> including state information.

Docs.exception: is not a valid membership condition element.

MemberSignature.Value: public void FromXml (System.Security.SecurityElement e, System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel level);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void FromXml(class System.Security.SecurityElement e, class System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel level) cil managed

Docs.param: The that contains the XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
Docs.summary: Uses the specified XML encoding to reconstruct a security object, using the specified policy level context.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The policy level context is provided for resolution of named permission set references. For example, code groups use policy level to find named permission sets.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the FromXml method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Policy.GacMembershipCondition> class.

Docs.exception: is not a valid membership condition element.
